cui_name: POSTERIOR COLUMN ATAXIA WITH RETINITIS PIGMENTOSA
reasoning: Syndrome combining posterior column ataxia and retinitis pigmentosa is extremely rare, likely representing specific inherited conditions (e.g., certain mitochondrial disorders or hereditary spastic paraplegia variants). Estimated <0.1 per 100k births based on case report frequency. Very low confidence due to rarity and limited epidemiological data.
